dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3053 IH: No Taxpayer Funding for United Nations Green Climate Fund Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Good of Virginia (for himself, Mr. Norman, and Mr. Perry) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit contributions to the United Nations Green Climate Fund, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Taxpayer Funding for United Nations Green Climate Fund Act.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Secretary of State—

paragraph.text: shall withhold from mandatory United States contributions to the United Nations, in each fiscal year, an amount that represents the same proportion to the total United States contribution to the United Nations as the proportion of the United Nations budget for such fiscal year that will be made available to the United Nations Green Climate fund in that fiscal year; and
may not make any voluntary contribution to the United Nations Green Climate Fund.

subsection.text: Amounts withheld from contributions pursuant to the prohibition under subsection (a)—

paragraph.text: shall, on the date on which the balance of such United States contribution to the United Nations is made, be rescinded; and
may not be considered, on or after such date, to be arrears to be repaid to the United Nations or to any entity of the United Nations.
